body_html:
Hi, @raginisharma14 . Could you give a more concise (minimal, self-contained) reproduced code?

If I understand correctly, Tensor conversion requested dtype int64 for Tensor with dtype float32 means that int64 is expected here, not float32. Hence it seems a little surprising for me to use tf.to_float(xxxx).
body_text:
Hi, @raginisharma14 . Could you give a more concise (minimal, self-contained) reproduced code?
If I understand correctly, Tensor conversion requested dtype int64 for Tensor with dtype float32 means that int64 is expected here, not float32. Hence it seems a little surprising for me to use tf.to_float(xxxx).
body:
Hi, @raginisharma14 . Could you give a more concise (minimal, self-contained) reproduced code?

If I understand correctly, `Tensor conversion requested dtype int64 for Tensor with dtype float32` means that int64 is expected here, not float32. Hence it seems a little surprising for me to use `tf.to_float(xxxx)`.
